pullRequest.body:
Adds some basic lemmas about `pathComponentIn`, analogous to existing lemmas about `pathComponent` and `connectedComponentIn`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsPathConnected.subset_pathComponentIn`
`+ isPathConnected_pathComponent`
`+ isPathConnected_pathComponentIn`
`+ mem_pathComponentIn_self`
`+ pathComponentIn_congr`
`+ pathComponentIn_mono`
`+ pathComponentIn_nonempty_iff`
`+ pathComponentIn_subset`

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Thanks for the quick adjustments! To make future reviewing easier, can you (the next time)
- remove the awaiting-author label when you have addressed all comments (otherwise, the PR might be visible as ready for review)
- resolve any review comments you consider addressed? Thanks!

Thanks for the quick adjustments! To make future reviewing easier, can you (the next time)
- remove the awaiting-author label when you have addressed all comments (otherwise, the PR might be visible as ready for review)
- resolve any review comments you consider addressed? Thanks!

Oh, sure - I just wanted to get those changes made to the other PR too first, and then got distracted while doing so ðŸ˜…

But thanks for the reminder, I wasn't sure whether I should resolve the review comments myself or wait for you to take another look.

As for the suggested `@[simp]` tags, I'm not sure I understand the tactic well enough to accurately judge whether adding those make sense - at least in the case of `mem_pathComponentIn_self`, that would require changing the statement of the lemma to an iff, right? Since simp can only rewrite, not automatically resolve hypotheses like `x âˆˆ F`?

I could do that and also add a simp tag to `pathComponentIn_nonempty_iff` if you want, but I don't know if they will come up often enough for that to be preferred. The analogous lemmas for `connectedComponentIn` also don't have simp tags yet.
Can you merge master, please (just to make sure the diff looks right after the recent PR) - then I'll ping this on the reviewers channel.
@grunweg I hope this is what you meant? the diff still looks good to me, it appears the file wasn't touched since I wrote this PR
Yes, that's perfect! *Knowing* it wasn't touched is just what I needed. I've asked again on zulip.
Let's merge it as is. I'll PR `@[simp]` attrs later. `simp` replaces propositions it can prove with `True`.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11411537609/job/31755951489)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11411537609/job/31755951154)

Thanks!
maintainer merge

Thanks for working on this corner of the library! These lemmas look good to me (but I don't know that part of the library very well).
I have a few style comments to make, see below. Once you fixed them, I will happily `maintainer merge` this PR.

Thanks!
maintainer merge

similarly below, I won't label all occurrences
```suggestion
  fun _ hy â†¦ hy.target_mem

Please also put a space after a comma, as in the following. Same applies to the other items below.
```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun âŸ¨_, âŸ¨Î³, hÎ³âŸ©âŸ© â†¦ Î³.source â–¸ hÎ³ 0, fun hx â†¦ âŸ¨x, mem_pathComponentIn_self hxâŸ©âŸ©
This *might* be written more cleaner in tactic mode, using `ext` and `exact`. Can you at least try this, please?

```suggestion
theorem pathComponentIn_nonempty_iff : (pathComponentIn x F).Nonempty â†” x âˆˆ F :=
```
Should this be a `@[simp]` lemma?

```suggestion
@[gcongr]
theorem pathComponentIn_mono {G : Set X} (h : F âŠ† G) :
```
`@[simp]`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Connected/PathConnected): some lemmas for `pathComponentIn`
